'UGH, UGH, UGH.'she heaved a huge sigh and realized why she had chosen dreamonmissy as her name. 'They are almost always just out of reach--dreams. If only.' she thought, over and over. She had been applying for jobs for herself and her partner all over the globe despite the fact that they had a very well paying job to go to in just 2 weeks. However, the whole point of exploring other avenues was the same goal most of us have-to make more money- hopefully at a nicer camp, maybe a different country for some adventure? She had applied to so many places-in her partners name, since he has the ticket-the process of applying became a job in itself. Okay, a kind of obssesive job with seemingly no purpose as no company had really bitten. Just when she was ready to give up and concentrate more on working out and preparing to leave for their camp job the long awaited, e-mail that never arrived, arrived. "Oh, of course," she breathed at her shrunken down golden retriever that looked a lot like a yorkie. Okay, it is a yorkie. "Princess! Who would have guessed?" It was a job she never really thought she'd luck into, living for free on an island on the west coast of B.C. where she could watch whales in her spare time. She'd have plenty of that since it was a 40 hour work week, instead of the 12 hour a day, 7 days a week type of job she was heading to the bush for-because of the money. That's where the UGH came in. The money. She knew her partner would never go for it. They were basically offering half of what they would make on the GORGEOUS island. She had researched the island all day, ignoring the money thing, hoping they would come up with a better offer. 'Geez, the marina had mountains behind, an ocean in front and WHALES!' she thought again, and again. All day she dreamt of the all that it would be. 'A lighthouse.." she'd always loved lighthouses. 'Diving, sailing..' though she likely wasn't brave enough. But mainly, she couldn''t stop dreaming about having that vast, mysterious, changing, beautiful blue ocean stretched out in front of her every wonderful day. Her partner had been up north at a temporary job so she had to wait for his call in the morning to get the answer she already knew was coming but couldn't help trying to think of a way to gloss over the money thing and ever so cunningly plant the picture of it all in his mind. ' He could come around-not. Dream on Missy.

Hi all. Found this site and figured it would be a good way to keep in touch with the real world while I'm stuck in the northern bush. Not gone yet but will be soon! Whenever I can, I'll be here to give you all a taste of the remote camp life. I'm sure it will sound a lot like a soap opera since camp dwellers all become intertwined in each others lives, being stuck together for so long. However, any similarity to actual people living or seemingly dead is purely coincidental. From here on in this is a work of fiction. Pick a bush - any bush (by Fort Nowhere) and that's where this takes place. wink, wink :) The next time you see me I won't be here - I'll be there.
